entities.name: gargoyle
entities.description: The gargoyle is described as being knocked aside and looking a little punch-drunk. It is also mentioned that Harry wondered whether it would be able to distinguish passwords anymore.

entities.name: headmasterâ€™s study
entities.description: The headmaster's study is where the gargoyle was guarding the entrance and where Harry had left his Pensieve.

entities.name: Harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character who is navigating through the castle and interacting with the gargoyle and other entities.

entities.name: Pensieve
entities.description: The Pensieve is a stone object that Harry had left on the desk in the headmaster's study.

entities.name: Hogwarts
entities.description: Hogwarts is mentioned as the school where the headmasters and headmistresses are giving Harry a standing ovation.

entities.name: Dilys Derwent
entities.description: Dilys Derwent is one of the headmistresses of Hogwarts who is giving Harry a standing ovation and sobbing.

relationships.description: Harry interacted with the gargoyle by asking it if they could go up and then clambering over it to get onto the spiral staircase.
Harry had left his Pensieve on the desk in the headmaster's study.
The headmasters and headmistresses of Hogwarts were giving Harry a standing ovation, waving their hats and wigs and dancing on the chairs.
Dilys Derwent was also giving Harry a standing ovation and sobbing.
